content.question: Which of the following best describes the legal basis for segregated waiting rooms like the one depicted in the image?

choices.label: Presidential executive orders focused on equal economic opportunity rather than the segregation of public facilities.
The Supreme Court ruled in Plessy v. Ferguson that segregated facilities created by state laws were constitutional.
The Supreme Court ruling in Brown v. Board of Education addressed segregation in education but not in transportation.
Amendments to the United States Constitution gave the states broad powers to manage public infrastructure.

content.answer: The Supreme Court ruled in Plessy v. Ferguson that segregated facilities created by state laws were constitutional.
